arma

Class Mat

  • java.lang.Object
    • arma.Mat

  • public class Mat
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a real-valued dense matrix with member functions and attributes that are similar to the Armadillo C++ Algebra Library (Armadillo) by Conrad Sanderson et al., based on DenseMatrix64F from Peter Abeles' Efficient Java Matrix Library (EJML) Version 0.23 from 21.06.2013.

    If not stated otherwise, the provided interfaces should be identical to Armadillo (e.g. same ordering of arguments, accepted values, ...). However, this project is based on EJML to provide a pure Java solution, which is why numeric results may slightly differ from the Armadillo C++ Algebra Library.

    Note: Armadillo stores values by column-major-ordering, while EJML stores them by row-major ordering. In order to be similar to Armadillo, all interfaces work as if column-major-ordering is used while converting to row-major ordering internally.

    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann
    See Also:
    Armadillo C++ Algebra Library, Efficient Java Matrix Library

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F _matrix
      The internal data representation of the matrix.
      int n_cols
      The number of columns in the matrix.
      int n_elem
      The number of elements (same as n_rows * n_cols) in the matrix.
      int n_rows
      The number of rows in the matrix.

      (package private) int convertMajorOrdering(int n)
      Converts the position of an element based on a column-major-ordered one-dimensional view of the matrix into a row-major-ordered based one, in order to provide interfaces similar to Armadillo's Mat while using EJML's DenseMatrix64F.

    • Method Detail

      • at

        public double at(int n)
        Returns the value of the nth element of a column-major-ordered one-dimensional view of the matrix. Note: at(i, j) = at(i + j * n_rows).
        Parameters:
        n - The position of the element.
        Returns:
        The value of the nth element.
        See Also:
        at(int, int)

      • at

        public double at(int i,
        int j)
        Returns the value of the element at the nth row and jth column.
        Parameters:
        i - The row of the element.
        j - The column of the element.
        Returns:
        The value of the element at the nth row and jth column.
        See Also:
        at(int)

      • at

        public void at(int n,
      Op operation,
      double operand)
        Performs a right-hand side operation on the value of the nth element of a column-major-ordered one-dimensional view of the matrix. The value of the requested element will be overwritten by the result of the operation. Note: at(i, j) = at(i + j * n_rows).
        Parameters:
        n - The position of the left-hand side operand.
        operation - The operation to be performed. See getResult(double, Op, double) for more details.
        operand - The right-hand side operand.
        See Also:
        at(int, int, Op, double), getResult(double, Op, double)

      • at

        public void at(int i,
      int j,
      Op operation,
      double operand)
        Performs a right-hand side operation on the value of the element at the nth row and jth column. The value of the requested element will be overwritten by the result of the operation.
        Parameters:
        i - The row of the left-hand side operand.
        j - The column of the left-hand side operand.
        operation - The operation to be performed. See getResult(double, Op, double) for more details.
        operand - The right-hand side operand.
        See Also:
        at(int, Op, double), getResult(double, Op, double)

        public void row(int i,
       Op operation,
       Mat operand)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Performs a right-hand side element-wise operation on all elements of the ith row.
        Parameters:

      • set_size

        public void set_size(int numberOfRows,
            int numberOfColumns)
        Changes the dimension of the matrix to n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns and neither guarantees to reuse the values of the elements, nor their positions.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.
        See Also:
        reshape(int, int, boolean), resize(int, int)

      • reshape

        public void reshape(int numberOfRows,
           int numberOfColumns,
           boolean rowWise)
        Changes the dimension of the matrix to n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns and guarantees to reuses the values of the elements, but not their positions. The elements of the current matrix are either accessed row-wise (rowWise = true) or column-wise ( rowWise = false), while the new matrix is always filled column-wise.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.
        rowWise - The access of the elements of the current matrix .
        See Also:
        set_size(int, int), resize(int, int)

      • reshape

        public void reshape(int numberOfRows,
           int numberOfColumns)
        Equivalent to reshape(numberOfRows, numberOfColumns, true)
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.

      • resize

        public void resize(int numberOfRows,
          int numberOfColumns)
        Changes the dimension of the matrix to n_rows = numberOfRows and n_cols = numberOfColumns and guarantees to reuses the values of the elements and their positions.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRows - The new number of rows of the matrix.
        numberOfColumns - The new number of columns of the matrix.
        See Also:
        set_size(int, int), reshape(int, int, boolean)

      • divide

        public Mat divide(double operand)
        Creates a new matrix being the quotient of a right-hand side (element-wise) division with the provided divisor. The single provided right-hand side value is used for all operations.
        Parameters:
        operand - The divisor.
        Returns:
        The created matrix.
        See Also:
        elemDivide(double)

      • divide

        public Mat divide(Mat operand)
        Creates a new matrix being the quotient of a right-hand side matrix division with the provided divisor. Fails if the provided divisor is not invertible.
        Parameters:
        operand - The divisor.
        Returns:
        The created matrix.

      • elemDivide

        public Mat elemDivide(double operand)
        Creates a new matrix being the quotient of a right-hand side (element-wise) division with the provided divisor. The single provided right-hand side value is used for all operations.
        Parameters:
        operand - The divisor.
        Returns:
        The created matrix.
        See Also:
        divide(double)

      • elemDivide

        public Mat elemDivide(Mat operand)
        Creates a new matrix being the quotient of a right-hand side (element-wise) division with the provided divisor.
        Parameters:
        operand - The divisor.
        Returns:
        The created matrix.

      • getResult

        private static double getResult(double a,
               Op operation,
               double b)
                         throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Performs the requested binary arithmetic operation on a and b or sets a to the value of b if operation = Op.EQUAL.
        Parameters:
        a - The left-hand side operand.
        operation - The operation to be performed. Only arithmetic operators and equality are supported.
        b - The right-hand side operand.
        Returns:
        The result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown if another operation besides arithmetic operators or equality is requested.
        See Also:
        Op

      • updateAttributes

        private void updateAttributes()
        Updates the attributes n_rows, n_cols and n_elem of the matrix. Should be called right after the shape of the matrix is changed.

      • convertMajorOrdering

        int convertMajorOrdering(int n)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts the position of an element based on a column-major-ordered one-dimensional view of the matrix into a row-major-ordered based one, in order to provide interfaces similar to Armadillo's Mat while using EJML's DenseMatrix64F.
        Parameters:
        n - The position based on column-major-ordering.
        Returns:
        The position based on row-major-ordering.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if a negative value is provided for the position.
